canonical_explanation.text: Time helps us know when things happen. A day has morning, afternoon, evening, and night. There are 7 days in a week: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. We use a clock to read time. When the long hand points to 12 and the short hand points to a number, we say that number o'clock.
rules: There are 7 days in a week.
Days in order: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday.
A day has parts: morning, afternoon, evening, night.
The short hand on a clock shows the hour.
When the long hand is on 12, we read the hour as 'o'clock'.

questions.question_text: How many days are there in a week?
questions.explanation_correct: There are 7 days in a week.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A week has exactly 7 days: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday.

questions.question_text: Which day comes after Monday?
questions.explanation_correct: Tuesday comes after Monday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order is: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday... After Monday comes Tuesday.

questions.question_text: Which day comes before Friday?
questions.explanation_correct: Thursday comes before Friday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order is: ...Wednesday, Thursday, Friday. Before Friday is Thursday.

questions.question_text: The first day of the week is ____.
questions.explanation_correct: Sunday is the first day of the week.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In India, the week starts on Sunday.

questions.question_text: Which day comes after Saturday?
questions.explanation_correct: Sunday comes after Saturday. The week starts again.
questions.explanation_incorrect: After Saturday, the week starts again with Sunday.

questions.question_text: When do we wake up?
questions.explanation_correct: We wake up in the morning.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Most people wake up in the morning, when the sun comes up.

questions.question_text: When do we go to sleep?
questions.explanation_correct: We go to sleep at night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Most people sleep at night, when it is dark outside.

questions.question_text: What comes after morning?
questions.explanation_correct: Afternoon comes after morning.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order is: morning, afternoon, evening, night.

questions.question_text: Which happens first: eating dinner or eating breakfast?

options.text: Both happen at the same time

questions.explanation_correct: Breakfast is eaten in the morning, which comes before dinner in the evening.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Breakfast is the first meal of the day (morning). Dinner is in the evening. Breakfast comes first.

questions.question_text: Which happens later: lunch or breakfast?
questions.explanation_correct: Lunch happens later. Breakfast is in the morning and lunch is in the afternoon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Breakfast is in the morning, lunch is around noon or afternoon. Lunch comes later.

questions.question_text: If the short hand points to 3 and the long hand points to 12, what time is it?
questions.explanation_correct: It is 3 o'clock. The short hand shows the hour (3) and the long hand on 12 means exactly on the hour.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When the long hand is on 12, we read the number the short hand points to. Short hand on 3 = 3 o'clock.

questions.question_text: If the short hand points to 8 and the long hand points to 12, what time is it?
questions.explanation_correct: It is 8 o'clock. The short hand on 8 and long hand on 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Short hand shows the hour. Short hand on 8, long hand on 12 = 8 o'clock.

questions.question_text: School starts at 8 o'clock. Where should the short hand point?
questions.explanation_correct: For 8 o'clock, the short hand should point to 8.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand shows the hour. For 8 o'clock, it points to 8.

questions.question_text: If today is Wednesday, what was yesterday?
questions.explanation_correct: If today is Wednesday, yesterday was Tuesday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The day before Wednesday is Tuesday.

questions.question_text: If today is Friday, what is tomorrow?
questions.explanation_correct: If today is Friday, tomorrow is Saturday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The day after Friday is Saturday.

questions.question_text: Which day is between Tuesday and Thursday?
questions.explanation_correct: Wednesday is between Tuesday and Thursday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order is: Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday. Wednesday is between them.

questions.question_text: Riya's school ends at 2 o'clock in the afternoon. She plays in the park in the evening. Which happens first?
questions.explanation_correct: School ends in the afternoon, which is before evening. So school ending happens first.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Afternoon comes before evening. School ends first, then she plays in the park.

questions.question_text: When the short hand is on 6 and the long hand is on 12, the time is ____ o'clock.
questions.explanation_correct: The time is 6 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand shows the hour. Short hand on 6 = 6 o'clock.

questions.question_text: There are 5 days in a week.
questions.explanation_correct: False. There are 7 days in a week, not 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. A week has 7 days: Sunday through Saturday.

questions.question_text: Aarav brushes his teeth, then eats breakfast, then goes to school. What does he do first?
questions.explanation_correct: Aarav brushes his teeth first, then eats breakfast, then goes to school.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The first activity mentioned is brushing teeth. That happens earliest.

questions.question_text: Priya eats dinner at 7 o'clock. What does the short hand of the clock show?
questions.explanation_correct: At 7 o'clock, the short hand points to 7.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand shows the hour. At 7 o'clock, it points to 7.

questions.question_text: If today is Sunday, what day was it two days ago?
questions.explanation_correct: Two days before Sunday: Saturday (1 day back), Friday (2 days back).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Count back from Sunday: 1 day back = Saturday, 2 days back = Friday.

questions.question_text: When is it dark outside?
questions.explanation_correct: It is dark outside at night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At night, the sun has set and it is dark outside.

questions.question_text: The day after Thursday is ____.
questions.explanation_correct: Friday comes after Thursday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In the order of days: Thursday, Friday. After Thursday comes Friday.

questions.question_text: The day before Tuesday is ____.
questions.explanation_correct: Monday comes before Tuesday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In the order of days: Monday, Tuesday. Before Tuesday is Monday.

questions.question_text: Which hand on the clock is shorter?
questions.explanation_correct: The hour hand (short hand) is shorter than the minute hand (long hand).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A clock has two hands. The hour hand is the shorter one. The minute hand is longer.

questions.question_text: Which activity usually happens in the morning?
questions.explanation_correct: Going to school usually happens in the morning.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Children go to school in the morning. Stars are seen at night, dinner is in the evening.

questions.question_text: Put these in order from earliest to latest: evening, morning, night, afternoon
questions.explanation_correct: From earliest to latest: morning, afternoon, evening, night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct order of a day: morning, afternoon, evening, night.

questions.question_text: If today is Monday, then tomorrow is Tuesday.
questions.explanation_correct: True. The day after Monday is Tuesday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Monday, Tuesday â€” Tuesday comes after Monday.

questions.question_text: If the short hand is on 12 and the long hand is also on 12, what time is it?
questions.explanation_correct: Both hands on 12 means it is 12 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Short hand on 12 = hour 12. Long hand on 12 = exactly on the hour. So it is 12 o'clock.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a day of the week?
questions.explanation_correct: 'Funday' is not a real day of the week.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The 7 days are: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. 'Funday' is not one of them.

questions.question_text: Diya has dance class at 4 o'clock and homework at 6 o'clock. Which comes first?
questions.explanation_correct: 4 o'clock comes before 6 o'clock. Dance class is first.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 4 o'clock is earlier than 6 o'clock. Dance class happens first.

questions.question_text: When the short hand is on 1 and the long hand is on 12, the time is ____ o'clock.
questions.explanation_correct: The time is 1 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Short hand on 1, long hand on 12 = 1 o'clock.

questions.question_text: If today is Thursday, what will be the day after tomorrow?
questions.explanation_correct: Today is Thursday, tomorrow is Friday, day after tomorrow is Saturday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Thursday + 1 = Friday (tomorrow), Thursday + 2 = Saturday (day after tomorrow).

questions.question_text: We eat lunch in the afternoon.
questions.explanation_correct: True. Lunch is usually eaten around noon or in the early afternoon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Lunch time is around the middle of the day, in the afternoon.

questions.question_text: Which happens earlier: sunset or sunrise?
questions.explanation_correct: Sunrise happens in the morning, which is earlier than sunset in the evening.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun rises in the morning and sets in the evening. Sunrise is earlier.

questions.question_text: Kabir's bedtime is 9 o'clock at night. What number does the short hand point to?
questions.explanation_correct: At 9 o'clock, the short hand points to 9.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand shows the hour. At 9 o'clock, it points to 9.

questions.question_text: Arjun goes to school on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday. How many days does he go to school?
questions.explanation_correct: Arjun goes to school 5 days a week: Monday through Friday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Count: Monday (1), Tuesday (2), Wednesday (3), Thursday (4), Friday (5). That is 5 days.

questions.question_text: The day before today is called ____.
questions.explanation_correct: The day before today is called 'yesterday'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Yesterday is the name for the day that came before today.

questions.question_text: The day after today is called ____.
questions.explanation_correct: The day after today is called 'tomorrow'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tomorrow is the name for the day that comes after today.

questions.question_text: Which of these do you do in the evening?

options.text: Play in the park after school

questions.explanation_correct: Playing in the park after school is an evening activity.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Waking up is morning, school is daytime, sleeping is night. Playing after school is in the evening.

questions.question_text: At 5 o'clock, the short hand points to 5.
questions.explanation_correct: True. At 5 o'clock, the short (hour) hand points to 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. The short hand shows the hour number.

questions.question_text: Wednesday comes after Thursday.
questions.explanation_correct: False. Wednesday comes BEFORE Thursday, not after.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. The order is: Wednesday, Thursday. Wednesday comes before Thursday.

questions.question_text: Neha watches the moon. When does she most likely see it?
questions.explanation_correct: The moon is usually seen at night when the sky is dark.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We can see the moon best at night when the sky is dark.

questions.question_text: The clock shows the short hand on 10 and long hand on 12. What time is it?
questions.explanation_correct: Short hand on 10, long hand on 12 = 10 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand shows the hour. It is on 10, so the time is 10 o'clock.

questions.question_text: Aarav has a holiday on Saturday and Sunday. How many holiday days does he have each week?
questions.explanation_correct: Saturday and Sunday make 2 holiday days each week.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Count: Saturday (1) and Sunday (2). That is 2 holiday days.

questions.question_text: Siya's daily routine: wake up, brush teeth, have breakfast, go to school. She forgot one step. She woke up, had breakfast, and went to school. What did she forget?
questions.explanation_correct: Siya forgot to brush her teeth. That step is missing from her routine.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The full routine is: wake up, brush teeth, breakfast, school. She skipped brushing teeth.

questions.question_text: If yesterday was Saturday, what day is today?
questions.explanation_correct: If yesterday was Saturday, today is Sunday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Today is the day after yesterday. Saturday + 1 = Sunday.

questions.question_text: When the short hand is on 4 and the long hand is on 12, it is ____ o'clock.
questions.explanation_correct: Short hand on 4, long hand on 12 = 4 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand tells the hour. It is pointing to 4, so it is 4 o'clock.

questions.question_text: Which order of events makes sense?

options.text: Wake up, go to school, eat breakfast
Wake up, eat breakfast, go to school

questions.explanation_correct: Wake up first, then eat breakfast, then go to school. This is the correct order.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sensible order is: wake up (morning), eat breakfast (morning), then go to school.
